section.title: Continuation Tokens
section.t: A continuation token provides cryptographic linkage between evidence collection sessions for the same document. This enables the Verifier to assess the complete authorship timeline even when the Attester's collection process spans multiple sessions.

section.title: Token Format
section.t: Each continuation token is a CBOR-encoded structure containing:

list.t: session_id: A unique identifier for the current session (UUIDv7 per ).
prev_hash: SHA-256 digest of the previous session's final evidence packet.
timestamp: The session start time in RFC 3339 format.
hmac: HMAC-SHA-256 binding the token to the Attester's device identity key.

section.title: Chain Integrity
section.t: The Verifier validates the continuation chain by verifying that each token's prev_hash matches the hash of the preceding session's terminal evidence packet. A break in the chain indicates either evidence tampering or a gap in the collection process, which the Verifier MUST flag in the Attestation Result.
